cellassign 0.0.0.9000

    • Assigning single-cells to known cell types with cellassign

    Assigning single-cells to known cell types with cellassign

    Allen W Zhang and Kieran R Campbell

    April 2018

    introduction-to-cellassign.Rmd

    Overview

    cellassign assigns cells measured using single cell RNA sequencing to known cell types based on marker gene information. Unlike other supervised methods for assigning cell types from single cell RNA-seq data, cellassign does not require labeled single cell or bulk expression data – cellassign only needs to know whether or not each given gene is a marker of each cell type.

    Installation

    cellassign depends on tensorflow, which can be installed as follows:

    install.packages("tensorflow")
library(tensorflow)
install_tensorflow()

    You can confirm that the installation succeeded by running:

    sess = tf$Session()
hello <- tf$constant('Hello, TensorFlow!')
sess$run(hello)

    For more details see the Rstudio page on tensorflow installation.

    cellassign can then be installed using the devtools package via

    devtools::install_github("Irrationone/cellassign")

    Basic usage

    library(tidyverse)
library(scater)
library(splatter)
library(edgeR)
library(cellassign)

    Example data

    data(example_sce, package = "cellassign")
    print(example_sce)
#> class: SingleCellExperiment 
#> dim: 1000 500 
#> metadata(1): params
#> assays(6): BatchCellMeans BaseCellMeans ... TrueCounts counts
#> rownames(1000): Gene1 Gene2 ... Gene999 Gene1000
#> rowData names(6): Gene BaseGeneMean ... DEFacGroup1 DEFacGroup2
#> colnames(500): Cell1 Cell2 ... Cell499 Cell500
#> colData names(4): Cell Batch Group ExpLibSize
#> reducedDimNames(0):
#> spikeNames(0):

    We can look at the true group assignments:

    colData(example_sce)$Group %>% table
#> .
#> Group1 Group2 
#>    236    264

    Constructing a marker gene matrix

    The next step is to construct a binary marker gene matrix that expresses our a priori knowledge of cell types.

    Since we’re using simulated data, we can pick genes that we made to be group-specific markers.

    rowdat <- rowData(example_sce)

markers_group1 <- rowdat %>% as.data.frame %>% dplyr::filter(DEFacGroup1 > 1.3)
markers_group2 <- rowdat %>% as.data.frame %>% dplyr::filter(DEFacGroup2 > 1.3)

    Next, we’ll pick a few of these for each group, so as to not give CellAssign all the information.

    set.seed(4242)
genes1 <- as.character(sample(markers_group1$Gene, size = 5))
genes2 <- as.character(sample(markers_group2$Gene, size = 5))
    marker_list <- list(
  'Group1'=genes1,
  'Group2'=genes2
)

    We can conveniently convert this list into a binary matrix.

    rho <- marker_list_to_mat(marker_list, include_other = FALSE)

    Note that we have explicitly specified to not include an other class here (the default is to include one).

    Running CellAssign

    Compute size factors

    norm_factors <- edgeR::calcNormFactors(as.matrix(counts(example_sce)), method = "TMM")
lib_size_factors <- colSums(as.matrix(counts(example_sce)))

sizeFactors(example_sce) <- norm_factors * lib_size_factors / mean(norm_factors * lib_size_factors)

s <- sizeFactors(example_sce)

    Extract expression matrix

    Y <- t(counts(example_sce))[,rownames(rho)]

    Run CellAssign (EM)

    The following line runs the EM version of CellAssign.

    em_result <- cellassign_em(exprs_obj = Y, rho = rho, s = s, X = NULL, data_type = "RNAseq", n_batches = 1, num_runs = 1, learning_rate = 1e-2, use_priors = TRUE, prior_type = "shrinkage", B = 20, delta_variance_prior = TRUE, verbose = FALSE)
#> 1700 L old: -95777.4606566627; L new: -13747.6226932358; Difference (%): 0.856462860896705
#> 160  L old: -13747.6226932358; L new: -13732.2439003481; Difference (%): 0.00111865107377798
#> 20   L old: -13732.2439003481; L new: -13731.0976484561; Difference (%): 8.34715651948716e-05
#> 20   L old: -13731.0976484561; L new: -13730.073740291; Difference (%): 7.45685589951485e-05

#> 20   L old: -13729.1593923303; L new: -13728.3430721807; Difference (%): 5.94588587849388e-05
#> 20   L old: -13728.3430721807; L new: -13727.6143889607; Difference (%): 5.30787449109908e-05
#> 20   L old: -13727.6143889607; L new: -13726.9639895314; Difference (%): 4.73789116554296e-05

#> 20   L old: -13726.3834616731; L new: -13725.8652447581; Difference (%): 3.77533467844424e-05

#> 20   L old: -13725.4025480415; L new: -13724.9892763117; Difference (%): 3.01099897338412e-05

    em_result$cell_type %>% table
#> .
#> Group1 Group2 
#>    236    264
    example_sce <- example_sce %>% scater::mutate(EM_group=em_result$cell_type)
    with(colData(example_sce), table(Group, EM_group))
#>         EM_group
#> Group    Group1 Group2
#>   Group1    236      0
#>   Group2      0    264
